Now the question to ask is if one can obtain a state with
lower energy by allowing the density to vary. We indeed
find that the system can host localized stationary states
which we call solitons. Essential features of the soliton
can be captured through the following ansatz where the
soliton is spread over only three sites around a site
energy dominates in such soliton states. The transition
